result.execSummary:
The defendant Betsy M Lang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to maintain FTE/full time schooling.
No contact with victim, J.L. or Pawn America

Complete any assessment, treatment or counseling deemed necessary by agent.  Complete Thinking for a Change program.  AODA assessment and follow through.  Write letters of apology to J.L. and Pawn America.  

DNA sample.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Court costs as previously assessed.

Atty Longergan reads deft's written statement deft prepared for sentencing today
COURT ORDERS: 15CF430 Ct. 1 Burglary-building or dwelling: 7 years WSPS- 3 years IC, 4 years ES. 15CF725 Ct. 1 Fail/Report to county jail (10 days+): 5 years WSPS- 2 years IC, 3 years ES. Both sentences to run concurrent to each other. Deft is eligible for both prison programming- Substance Abuse & Challenge Incarceration. 
CONDITIONS of ES: Pay all outstanding costs- In 15CF430 Ct. 1- $206.00 in CC, $250.00 in DNA surcharge, $61.50 in restitution, $92.00 in victim witness surcharge; total $609.50. In 15CF725 Ct. 1- $176.00 in CC, $250.00 in DNA surcharge, $92.00 in victim witness surcharge; total $518.00. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol. Follow through with any after care or treatment as far as drug and alcohol issues and then follow through with any other assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two. 

COURT grants 247 days credit on both files. 

Deft is to remain at MCJ until resolution of all other outstanding open cases in Marathon County are completed, then will be transported to Prison.

Maintain GFE in full time work or full time school. DNA sample and surcharge. Pay CC.
